title: AI Fundamentals
description: Master the core concepts of artificial intelligence and machine learning with hands-on projects.

content.overview: Welcome to the fascinating world of Artificial Intelligence! In this opening chapter, we'll explore what AI really means and how it's transforming our world.

sections.title: What is Artificial Intelligence?
sections.content: Artificial Intelligence (AI) refers to the simulation of human intelligence in machines that are programmed to think like humans and mimic their actions. The term may also be applied to any machine that exhibits traits associated with a human mind such as learning and problem-solving.

sections.title: History of AI
sections.content: The field of AI research was born at a Dartmouth College workshop in 1956. Since then, AI has experienced several waves of optimism, followed by disappointment and the loss of funding (known as 'AI winters'), followed by new approaches, success and renewed funding.

sections.title: Types of AI
sections.content: AI can be categorized into three types: Narrow AI (weak AI), General AI (strong AI), and Artificial Superintelligence. Currently, we only have Narrow AI systems that can perform specific tasks.

keyPoints: Understanding the definition and scope of AI
Learning about the historical development of AI
Distinguishing between different types of AI systems
Recognizing AI applications in everyday life
content.practicalExercise: Identify 5 AI applications you use in your daily life and categorize them by type.

content.overview: Dive into the core concepts of machine learning, the driving force behind most modern AI applications.

sections.title: What is Machine Learning?
sections.content: Machine Learning is a subset of AI that provides systems the ability to automatically learn and improve from experience without being explicitly programmed. It focuses on the development of computer programs that can access data and use it to learn for themselves.

sections.title: Types of Machine Learning
sections.content: There are three main types of machine learning: Supervised Learning (learning with labeled data), Unsupervised Learning (finding patterns in unlabeled data), and Reinforcement Learning (learning through interaction with an environment).

sections.title: Common Algorithms
sections.content: Popular machine learning algorithms include Linear Regression, Decision Trees, Random Forest, Support Vector Machines, K-Means Clustering, and Neural Networks. Each has its strengths and is suited for different types of problems.

keyPoints: Differentiating between supervised and unsupervised learning
Understanding when to use different approaches
content.practicalExercise: Create a simple linear regression model to predict house prices using a sample dataset.

content.overview: Explore the building blocks of deep learning - neural networks and how they mimic the human brain.

sections.title: What are Neural Networks?
sections.content: Neural networks are computing systems inspired by biological neural networks. They consist of interconnected nodes (neurons) that work together to solve specific problems. Neural networks adapt and learn from data without being explicitly programmed.

sections.title: How Neural Networks Work
sections.content: Neural networks process information through layers of interconnected nodes. Each connection has a weight that adjusts as learning proceeds. The network learns by adjusting these weights to minimize prediction errors.

sections.title: Types of Neural Networks
sections.content: Common types include Feedforward Neural Networks, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) for image processing, Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs) for sequential data, and Transformer networks for natural language processing.

keyPoints: Learning how neurons and layers work together
Exploring different types of neural networks
content.practicalExercise: Build a simple neural network to classify handwritten digits using Python and TensorFlow.

content.overview: Take your understanding deeper with advanced neural network concepts and deep learning techniques.

sections.title: What is Deep Learning?
sections.content: Deep learning is a subset of machine learning that uses neural networks with multiple layers (hence 'deep') to model and understand complex patterns in data. It has been responsible for major breakthroughs in AI.

sections.title: Deep Learning Applications
sections.content: Deep learning powers image recognition, natural language processing, speech recognition, autonomous vehicles, medical diagnosis, and many other cutting-edge applications we see today.

sections.title: Training Deep Networks
sections.content: Training deep networks requires large amounts of data, significant computational power, and careful tuning of hyperparameters. Techniques like transfer learning and data augmentation help improve performance.

keyPoints: Understanding deep learning vs traditional ML
Learning about popular deep learning architectures
content.practicalExercise: Implement a convolutional neural network for image classification using a pre-trained model.

content.overview: Learn how AI systems can see and interpret visual information through computer vision techniques.

sections.title: Introduction to Computer Vision
sections.content: Computer vision is a field of AI that enables computers to interpret and make decisions based on visual data. It combines techniques from computer science, mathematics, and engineering.

sections.title: Image Processing Fundamentals
sections.content: Basic image processing involves operations like filtering, edge detection, feature extraction, and image transformations. These form the foundation for more complex computer vision tasks.

sections.title: Object Detection and Recognition
sections.content: Modern computer vision systems can detect and classify objects in images and videos with remarkable accuracy, using techniques like YOLO, R-CNN, and other deep learning approaches.

content.practicalExercise: Build an object detection system that can identify common objects in photographs.

content.overview: Discover how AI systems understand and generate human language through natural language processing.

sections.title: What is NLP?
sections.content: Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a branch of AI that helps computers understand, interpret and manipulate human language. It bridges the gap between human communication and computer understanding.

sections.title: Text Processing Techniques
sections.content: NLP involves various text processing techniques including tokenization, part-of-speech tagging, named entity recognition, sentiment analysis, and language translation.

sections.title: Modern NLP with Transformers
sections.content: Recent breakthroughs in NLP have come from transformer architectures like BERT, GPT, and T5, which have revolutionized how machines understand and generate text.

content.practicalExercise: Create a sentiment analysis tool that can classify movie reviews as positive or negative.

learningOutcomes: Understand the fundamental concepts of artificial intelligence
Apply AI techniques to real-world problems
Make informed decisions about AI applications
